means: 不合时代的事，过时的事或人

sentence.Network_en: The President tended to regard the Church as an anachronism.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统常常认为教会属于落伍之物。

sentence.Network_en: The monarchy is seen by many people as an anachronism in the modern world.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人认为君主制在现代世界不合时宜。

sentence.Network_en: The last paragraph contains an anachronism. The Holy Office no longer existed at that time.
sentence.Network_cn: 最后一段有一个时代错误。异端裁判所那时已经不存在了。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... chronograph 精密计时器 anachronism 年代错误 synchronize 同时发生.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(A) ... anachorism 地方不适当 anachronism 时代错误 anachronistic 时代错误的.
A&nbsp;words_森林_新浪博客 ... amorphous 无定形的 anachronism 不合时宜的 anagram 变位词.
型的时序倒错（anachronism），因为没有任何历史资料表明两者有直　　接关系。

list.abs: Yet historians note various anachronisms , such as horses , steel and wheat ., 但是历史学家注意到各种各样的时代错误 , 例如马 , 钢铁和小麦.
Yet historians note various anachronisms , such as horses , steel and wheat ., 此外 , 历史学家注意到各种年代错误 , 比如马匹 , 钢铁和小麦.
Business cards can sometimes feel like a bit of anachronism ., 商务名片有时候感觉好像有点过时.
It would be an anachronism to speak of George Washington riding in an automobile ., 说乔治华盛顿乘汽车是一种年代错误.
Contemporary monarchy is an anachronism ., 现代的君主政体是不合时宜的事物.
but such anachronisms have never been found .但是这样的化石并没有被发现。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from Greek anakhronismos, from ana- 'backwards' + khronos 'time'

entry.tran: 不合时代的事；过时现象
entry.def: You say that something is an anachronism when you think that it is out of date or old-fashioned.

example.ex: The President tended to regard the Church as an anachronism.
example.tran: 总统常常认为教会属于落伍之物。

entry.tran: 时代错误，年代误植（指所叙人、事与时代不符的错误）
entry.def: An anachronism is something in a book, play, or film that is wrong because it did not exist at the time the book, play, or film is set.

example.ex: The last paragraph contains an anachronism. The Holy Office no longer existed at that time.
example.tran: 最后一段有一个时代错误。异端裁判所那时已经不存在了。

means.word_mean: 1. something located at a time when it could not have existed or occurred
2. an artifact that belongs to another time
3. a person who seems to be displaced in time; who belongs to another age

auth_sentence.content: Some see the Committee as an unimportant anachronism.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some see the Committee as an unimportant anachronism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some see the Committee as an unimportant anachronism.

auth_sentence.content: Hancock wasn't such an anachronism, as it turns out.
auth_sentence.res_content: Hancock wasn't such an anachronism, as it turns out.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Hancock wasn't such an anachronism, as it turns out.

auth_sentence.content: The licence fee was meant to be revealed as an unnecessary anachronism.
auth_sentence.res_content: The licence fee was meant to be revealed as an unnecessary anachronism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The licence fee was meant to be revealed as an unnecessary anachronism.

stems_affixes.word_buile: chrono=chron时间+logical逻辑的→根据时间的逻辑来排列
syn共同+chron时间+ous……的→adj.同期的;同步的
chron时间+ology学科→有关时间的学科
chrono=chron时间+meter测量→测量时间→记时器
syn共同+chron时间+ize表动词→时间相同→同时发生

sentences.en: He is interested in the spirit of the play, and he is not averse to throwing in an anachronism or two if he thinks it will help underscore a point.
sentences.cn: 他对戏剧所体现的精神很感兴趣，如果有助于强调一个观点的话，他并不反对有一两个时代错误。
